result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. Trapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution of $3500 to Howard Gold. - Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Fine:  $379 - Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Costs: $200 -  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD / 11:46 AM Defendant Gregory J. Trapp in court, Pro Se.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has discussion with DEF on  proceeding without counsel and speaking with State.  DEF responds.

11:47AM On the record, appearances remain as above.  Court reviews off the record discussion.  State recites agreement, indicating if restitution of $3500 prepaid, State would amend charge to misdemeanor charge of theft by contractor, with $579 Fine/costs. State indicates victims rights complied with.  DEF agrees with agreement as recited by State.  Court asks Clerk to verify restitution prepaid.  Court amends charge to misdemeanor.  DEF enters NC plea to amended charge.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty of amended charge.  State makes statement prior to sentencing, asking Court to accept joint recommendation.  State indicates victim present.  Victim makes statement, willing to accept resolution as stated by State.  DEF has no comment.  Court to follow agreement.  Court instructs DEF to provide DNA sample & DEF receives DNA instruction card. 

COURT:  Restitution $3500, Clerk of Court authorized to submit restitution to victim.  Fine/costs $579, which includes DNA surcharge.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge. Pay all obligations within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Gregory J. Trapp in court.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF temporarily waives right to attorney to speak to DA office.   Court finds the DEF has freely waives his right to attorney for settlement purposes.   Court gives the attorney colloquy.   Bond Continues.  DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   Court orders DEF to speak to DA office, and set appt.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
